title: Compute the spreadsheet column encoding
hint: There are 26 characters in [A, Z], and each can be mapped to an integer
problem:
Spreadsheets often use an alphabetical encoding of the successive columns. Specifically, columns are identified by "A", "B", ..., "Y", "Z", "AA", "AB", ..., "ZZ", "AAA", "AAB", ...
   Implement a function that converts a spreadsheet column id to the corresponding integer, with "A" corresponding to 1. 
   For example, you should return 4 for "D", 27 for "AA", 702 for "ZZ", etc.
